column4: what mono has that makes it so great? There's Lot's of people talking about it.

apparently, C# is a nice language to write code in. With garbage collection and so. So if you wouldn't have to fear that M$ will dig up a dozen of patents next year to fight us and if it wouldn't run in a virutal machine it probably would be a nice language.
i guess many mono users don't care about .NIET compatibility
because they want to develop for linux, maybe?
